dt: {bc}to yield to the power, control, or possession of another upon compulsion or demand
{bc}to give up completely or agree to forgo especially in favor of another
{bc}to give (oneself) up into the power of another especially as a prisoner
{bc}to give (oneself) over to something (such as an influence)
{bc}to give oneself up into the power of another {bc}{sx|yield||}

pt: {sc}relinquish{/sc} {sc}yield{/sc} {sc}resign{/sc} {sc}surrender{/sc} {sc}abandon{/sc} {sc}waive{/sc} mean to give up completely. {sc}relinquish{/sc} usually does not imply strong feeling but may suggest some regret, reluctance, or weakness.
{sc}yield{/sc} implies concession or compliance or submission to force.
{sc}resign{/sc} emphasizes voluntary relinquishment or sacrifice without struggle.
{sc}surrender{/sc} implies a giving up after a struggle to retain or resist.
{sc}abandon{/sc} stresses finality and completeness in giving up.
{sc}waive{/sc} implies conceding or forgoing with little or no compulsion.

pt.t: {it}waived{/it} the right to a trial by jury

shortdef: to yield to the power, control, or possession of another upon compulsion or demand
to give up completely or agree to forgo especially in favor of another
to give (oneself) up into the power of another especially as a prisoner

dt: {bc}the action of yielding one's person or giving up the possession of something especially into the power of another
{bc}the relinquishment by a patentee of rights or claims under a patent
{bc}the delivery of a principal into lawful custody by bail
{bc}the voluntary cancellation of the legal liability of an insurance company by the insured and beneficiary for a consideration
{bc}the delivery of a fugitive from justice by one government to another

et: Middle English {it}surrendre{/it}, from Anglo-French, from {it}surrendre, susrendre{/it} to relinquish, from {it}sur- & sus-, suz{/it} under + {it}rendre{/it} to give back {ma}{mat|render|}, {mat|sous-chef|}{/ma}
shortdef: the action of yielding one's person or giving up the possession of something especially into the power of another
the relinquishment by a patentee of rights or claims under a patent
the delivery of a principal into lawful custody by bail —called also surrender by bail

dt: {bc}the giving up of oneself or one's will to some feeling or influence

dt.t: Recovery requires much less than self-help; it requires {wi}self-surrender{/wi}, to a higher power or cosmic truth or other nondenominational universal force.

shortdef: the giving up of oneself or one's will to some feeling or influence
